intro: Hieracium oreites, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with rough, hairy surfaces. Hieracium oreites is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude environments.
